content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality, Mississippi Office of Geology, Coastal and Energy Division </origin> <origin> Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality, Mississippi Office of Geology, Coastal and Energy Division </origin> <pubdate>1966 </pubdate> <title>1996 High Water MS Shoreline.lyr </title> <geoform>vector digital data </geoform> <serinfo> <sername>MS Historic Shoreline Inventory </sername> <issue>1966 </issue> </serinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Jackson, Mississippi </pubplace> <publish>Mississippi Office of Geology </publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>These data were aquired by the Mississippi Office of Geology (MOG), Coastal Geology and Energy Division as part of longterm shoreline monitoring exercises. </othercit> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>1966  high water line (HWL) shoreline survey of the Mississippi Gulf Coast.  Data were digitized from NOS U.S. Coast and Geodectic T-Sheets by Louisiana State University.  These shorelines represent reliable positions for use in analyzing rates of change and documenting the location of the shoreline.  In general the shoreline positions provide an accurate location to +/- 10 meters root mean square.  The T-Sheet data was gathered using survey techniques of the time.  Map scales of base data are 1:10,000. </abstract> <purpose>The data represent consistent documented shoreline data for the Mississippi coastline.  It is a valuable set of real world measurements for analysis of shoreline change and historic shoreline position.. </purpose> <supplinf>Base maps used to digitize the shoreline are also available </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1966 </caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition </current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete </progress> use by the MOG in shoreline analysis and historical shoreline documentation.  These data should not be used for surveys without ancillary information.  MOG does not endorse or recommend the use of data for any specific purpose. Data represent research mapping efforts. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Barbara Yassin </cntper> <cntorg>Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality, Mississippi Office of Geology, Coastal and Energy Division </cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Specialist </cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address </addrtype> <address>PO Box 20307 </address> <city>Jackson </city> <state>Mississippi </state> <postal>39289 </postal> <country>US </country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>601-961-5500 </cntvoice> <cnttdd>Unknown </cnttdd> <cntfax>601-961-5521 </cntfax> <cntemail>barbara_yassin@deq.state.ms.us </cntemail> <hours>M-F; 9 AM to 5 PM </hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>Mississippi Department of Environmental Quality, Mississippi Office of Geology, Coastal and Energy Division </datacred> <secinfo> <secsys>none </secsys> <secclass>Unclassified </secclass> <sechandl>none </sechandl> </secinfo> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350 </native> <progaff> <progname>Priority Habitat Information System </progname> </progaff> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Non measurable attributes. Attributes created during topology process </attraccr> </attracc> <logic>Data digitized from NOS T-Sheets and checked for errors using standard techniques and repeated use. </logic> <complete>Shoreline data include all of the Mississippi Sound and Gulf of Mexico shorelines.  Some years contain shoreline information for smaller bayous and bays.  The main purpose was to examine areas most likely to see significant shoreline change. </complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Accuracy based on:  Byrnes, M.R., R.A. McBride, and M.W. Hiland, 1991. Accuracy Standards and Development of a National Shoreline Change Database. In: Coastal Sediments '91.  American Society of Civil Engineers, New York, NY, pp. 1027-1042. </horizpar> <qhorizpa> <horizpav>9.7 </horizpav> <horizpae>+/- 9.7 meters rms for 1:10,000 maps </horizpae> </qhorizpa> </horizpa> <vertacc> <vertaccr>none reported </vertaccr> </vertacc> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service </origin> <pubdate>1966 </pubdate> <title>NOS T-Sheets </title> <geoform>vector digital data </geoform> <serinfo> <sername>T-Sheet </sername> <issue>NOS T-sheet </issue> </serinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Washington DC </pubplace> <publish>NOS </publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </srccite> <srcscale>10000 </srcscale> <typesrc>Map </typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>1966 </caldate> <time>unknown </time> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <srccurr>ground condition </srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>T-sheet </srccitea> <srccontr>T-sheets were used to digitize shoreline locations </srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc>T-sheets were corrected for datum shifts since being surveyed and then digitized using large format digitizing tables at LSU. Control points were used and are saved as a layer being offered. </procdesc> <srcused>T-sheet </srcused> <procdate>1991 </procdate> <proccont> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Barbara Yassin </cntper> <cntorg>Mississippi Office of Geology </cntorg> </cntperp> <cntpos>GIS Leader </cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing address </addrtype> <address>PO Box 20307 </address> <city>Jackson </city> <state>MS </state> <postal>39289 </postal> <country>US </country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>601-961-5500 </cntvoice> <cntfax>601-961-5521 </cntfax> <cntemail>barbara_yassin@deq.state.ms.us </cntemail> <hours>M-F; 9 AM to 5 PM </hours> </cntinfo> </proccont> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Vector </direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>String </sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>275 </ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Complete chain </sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>275 </ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Point </sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>4 </ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> </ptvctinf> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres>0.0000001 </latres> <longres>0.0000001 </longres> <geogunit>Decimal degrees </geogunit> </geograph> <geodetic> <horizdn>D_WGS_1984 </horizdn> <ellips>WGS_1984 </ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000 </semiaxis> <denflat>298.257224 </denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>None </enttypl> <enttypd>None </enttypd> <enttypds>None </enttypds> </enttyp> <attr> <attrlabl>FID </attrlabl> <attrdef>Internal feature number. </attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI </attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated. </udom> </attrdomv> </attr> </detailed> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>X006_shoreline_02ln </enttypl> <enttypd>Arc Attribute Table </enttypd> <enttypds>MS.
